Who could take amiss the rebuke of the kindly satirist‚ who was so ready to show up his own weaknesses? In this respect our own great satirist Thackeray is very like him. Nor is this strange. They had many points in common—the same keen eye for human folly, the same tolerance for the human weaknesses of which they were so conscious in themselveS, the same genuine kindness of heart.
